It tells the story of`` Blu, a domesticated macaw from small-town Minnesota,'' who`` meets the fiercely independent Jewel,'' and takes off on an adventure to Rio de Janeiro with this bird of his dreams. The blue domesticated bird is voiced by Jesse Adam Eisenberg , who has been nominated for an Oscar for his performance of Mark Elliot Zuckerberg in The Social Network . The United States must help Egyptians turn this democratic moment into a process that builds a government responsive to economic needs as well as demands for freedom, said Senator John Kerrey . well as demands for freedom,'' said Senator John Kerrey . Republican U.S. Senator John McCain , one of the first US politicians to urge Muhammad Hosni Mubarak to step down immediately, said Washington`` stands fully ready'' to help its ally begin the hard work of democratic reform. `` History will note that President Muhammad Hosni Mubarak 's last action in office was in the best interest of the country he loves,'' said U.S. Senator John McCain .`` It is the right decision for Egypt.''

ally`` begin the hard work of democratic reform.''`` History will note that President Muhammad Hosni Mubarak 's last action in office was in the best interest of the country he loves,'' said U.S. Senator John McCain . It is the right decision for Egypt. `` The Egyptian people are demanding a meaningful and irreversible transition to democracy, and I urge the Egyptian military to faithfully support and secure the coming process of political change,'' he said.

in unemployment rate not enough By Michael O'Brien - 02/04/11 09:53 AM ET The drop in the unemployment rate last month wasn't enough, Republicans said Friday in reaction to the latest jobless numbers. Instead of more` stimulus' spending and more debt, as the president proposed in his State of the Union address, we need less spending, more freedom, and more certainty for those in America who create jobs, House Speaker John Andrew Boehner ( R-Ohio) said in a statement. In truth, the report released Friday by the Bureau of Labor Statistics presented a mixed picture-- much like the political implications of the report.
